title: Christie’s to Offer ‘Five Nudes’ by Sanyu for HK$250 Million
text:
Text size

Five Nudes, the largest painting featuring female nudes by Chinese-French artist Sanyu, is returning to the auction market next month, with an estimate of HK$250 million (about US$32 million).

The painting, circa 1955, sold for HK$128 million at Ravenel Auction Hong Kong in 2011, setting a record for Sanyu and a record for any oil painting by a Chinese artist at that time.

The current auction record for Sanyu is the sale of his Nude, which fetched HK$198 million at Sotheby’s in Hong Kong on Oct. 5.

Christie will highlight Five Nudes at its evening sale of the 20th century and contemporary art in Hong Kong on Nov. 23.

Five Nudes, measuring 120-by-172 centimeters (47 inches-by-68 inches), is not only the largest painting of female nudes by Sanyu, it also features the greatest number of figures within a single composition by the artist, according to Christie’s.

There are approximately 56 known oil paintings of female nudes by Sanyu, and of these, only seven depict standing figures. Aside from Five Nudes, all of the other six compositions depict either a pair or single figures.

Five Nudes also features two other examples of Sanyu’s signature motifs: animals and flowers. While the female figures are standing on a bold yellow carpet with flower designs, cats can be seen playing at their feet.

Sanyu, also known as Chang Yu, was regarded as “the Chinese Matisse. ” He was born in China in 1901 and moved to Paris to study at the Académie de la Grande Chaumière in 1921. He never returned to China, and died in Paris in 1966 at age 64.
description: The current auction record for the Chinese-French artist is HK$198 million, with the sale of his ‘Nude’ earlier this month
